t: Isaiah 42
The Servant of the Lord
“Behold!*pn My Servant whom I uphold, My*ld Elect One in*i whom*i My soul delights! I*ld have put My Spirit upon Him; He*ld will bring forth justice to the Gentiles.
He*ld will not cry out, nor raise His*i voice,*i Nor*ld cause His voice to be heard in the street.
A*ld bruised reed He will not break, And*ld smoking flax He will not quench; He*ld will bring forth justice for truth.
He*ld will not fail nor be discouraged, Till*ld He has established justice in the earth; And*ld the coastlands shall wait for His law.”

Thus*ln says God the Lord,*s Who*ld created the heavens and stretched them out, Who*ld spread forth the earth and that which comes from it, Who*ld gives breath to the people on it, And*ld spirit to those who walk on it:
“I,*ld the Lord,*s have called You in righteousness, And*ld will hold Your hand; I*ld will keep You and give You as a covenant to the people, As*ld a light to the Gentiles,
To*ld open blind eyes, To*ld bring out prisoners from the prison, Those*ld who sit in darkness from the prison house.
I*ld am*i the Lord,*s that is*i My name; And*ld My glory I will not give to another, Nor*ld My praise to carved images.
Behold,*ld the former things have come to pass, And*ld new things I declare; Before*ld they spring forth I tell you of them.”
Praise to the Lord
Sing*pn to the Lord*s a new song, And*ild His praise from the ends of the earth, You*ld who go down to the sea, and all that is in it, You*ld coastlands and you inhabitants of them!
Let*ld the wilderness and its cities lift up their*i voice,*i The*ld villages that*i Kedar inhabits. Let*ld the inhabitants of Sela sing, Let*ld them shout from the top of the mountains.
Let*ld them give glory to the Lord,*s And*ld declare His praise in the coastlands.
The*ld Lord*s shall go forth like a mighty man; He*ld shall stir up His*i zeal like a man of war. He*ld shall cry out, yes, shout aloud; He*ld shall prevail against His enemies.
Promise of the Lord’s Help
“I*pn have held My peace a long time, I*ld have been still and restrained Myself. Now*ild I will cry like a woman in labor, I*ld will pant and gasp at once.
I*ld will lay waste the mountains and hills, And*ld dry up all their vegetation; I*ld will make the rivers coastlands, And*ld I will dry up the pools.

I*ld will bring the blind by a way they did not know; I*ld will lead them in paths they have not known. I*ld will make darkness light before them, And*ld crooked places straight. These*ld things I will do for them, And*ld not forsake them.
They*ld shall be turned back, They*ld shall be greatly ashamed, Who*ld trust in carved images, Who*ld say to the molded images, ‘You*ld are*i our gods.’
“Hear,*ln you deaf; And*ld look, you blind, that you may see.
Who*ld is*i blind but My servant, Or*ld deaf as My messenger whom*i I send? Who*ld is*i blind as he*i who*i is*i perfect, And*ld blind as the Lord’s*s servant?
Seeing*ld many things, but you do not observe; Opening*ld the ears, but he does not hear.”
Israel’s Obstinate Disobedience
The*pn Lord*s is well pleased for His righteousness’ sake; He*ld will exalt the law and make it*i honorable.

But*ld this is*i a people robbed and plundered; All*ld of them are snared in holes, And*ld they are hidden in prison houses; They*ld are for prey, and no one delivers; For*ld plunder, and no one says, “Restore!”
Who*ln among you will give ear to this? Who*ild will listen and hear for the time to come?
Who*ld gave Jacob for plunder, and Israel to the robbers? Was*ld it not the Lord,*s He*ld against whom we have sinned? For*ld they would not walk in His ways, Nor*ld were they obedient to His law.

Therefore*ld He has poured on him the fury of His anger And*ld the strength of battle; It*ld has set him on fire all around, Yet*ld he did not know; And*ld it burned him, Yet*ld he did not take it*i to heart.
